Reviews.Title: Good, light compromise
Reviews.Author: N. West
Reviews.Content: I began looking for a compromise, and inexpensive, laptop when I realized my Toshiba netbook was just TOO slow and the screen to tiny for my 50+ year old eyes. Barely tolerable when casually browsing or checking email, it struggled through even Plants vs. Zombies.  While I have a Gateway gaming laptop, it is 5 years old and weighs like 13 pounds.  I wanted something light but still able to do casual gaming.  I figured a 3rd gen Intel i3 and a 15 inch screen was the bare minimum I would settle for. After building a comparison spreadsheet of Best Buy available models, the Asus I began looking for a compromise, and inexpensive, laptop when I realized my Toshiba netbook was just TOO slow and the screen to tiny for my 50+ year old eyes. Barely tolerable when casually browsing or checking email, it struggled through even Plants vs. Zombies.  While I have a Gateway gaming laptop, it is 5 years old and weighs like 13 pounds.  I wanted something light but still able to do casual gaming.  I figured a 3rd gen Intel i3 and a 15 inch screen was the bare minimum I would settle for. After building a comparison spreadsheet of Best Buy available models, the Asus X501A-SPD0503W came out on top.  It was very close as it's specs were neck and neck with the Toshiba C855-S5111.  Unable to decide, I went with the Asus as it was only 4.5 pounds with battery installed (verified with a kitchen scale).versus the Toshiba's 5.4 pounds.  Aside from dealing with Windows 8, the Asus is just what I wanted.  Bloatware is minimal and what is there stays out of my way.Performance wise, here's how it compares with my other laptop on the Unigine Heaven Benchmark tool.Gateway FX-6160 ($1300 5 years ago); Windows Vista (build 6002, Service Pack 2) 64bit; Intel(R) Core(TM)2 Duo CPU T9300 @ 2.50GHz; NVIDIA GeForce 8800M GTSFPS: 14.1Score: 355Min FPS: 6.2Max FPS: 26.0Asus X501A $369;  Win 8; Intel Core i3-3120M @ 2.50 GHz; Intel HD graphics 4000.FPS: 9.3Score: 235Min FPS: 5.0Max FPS: 20.6That might not seem very good, but the Heaven benchmark is a demanding tool.  Playing a casual game like PanzerCorps (reboot of the Panzer General series from the 90's) shows no slowdown or other deficiencies.  The main point is how close it comes to matching the Core2Duo from just a few years ago

Reviews.Title: Pretty darn good
Reviews.Author: Megan
Reviews.Content: My old computer had a habit of continuously disconnecting from the internet so i decided i wanted a new one but on the cheaper end. This computer fulfills everything i wanted except it has windows 8. Its not so bad since i downloaded a modification that gives me a start button on the desktop screen. the parts i don't like are the track pad short cuts. i've figured out most of them by accident but i can't figure out how to turn them off. if you swipe one way it changes to the normal windows 8 screen if i swoosh another way it like opens up a view of all the pages i have open. It would be nice if i could turn them off. also the track pad's scroll function scrolls backwards it was really confusing at first but i quickly got used to it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value if you understand what you're buying
Reviews.Author: Erisian
Reviews.Content: I wanted an light, inexpensive computer for air travel vacations, with a larger screen than most ultrabooks.  This machine worked OK out of the box, no problems.Pros:  Very quiet fan, light weight for its screen size (no DVD drive helps), inexpensive, looks good.  Trackpad surface is excellent (many trackpads are too slick or too rough for comfort).Cons: Only 2 USB ports (1 is 3.0), mediocre keyboard.I'm very pleased with this machine so far.  Windows 8 works much better after installing free Classic Shell program to avoid pointless "Metro" start screen.  It's not ideal for playing Far Cry 3 or writing thousands of words a day, but I have other machines for more demanding tasks.  After replacing the hard drive with a basic SSD (required partial disassembly) this machine is very responsive and more than fast enough for my travel needs.

Reviews.Title: good for enough to use
Reviews.Author: David Chiang
Reviews.Content: reasonable price and enough to use for regular user,big screen and color were good for game player and college students too.

Reviews.Title: less than a year of light use - screw fell out, pads on bottom fell off, key randomly got weird
Reviews.Author: B. Jensen "Brian"
Reviews.Content: i'm not sure if it's windows 8 or asus, but i have also had lots of problems with crashing/freezing/deleting parts of files that i had saved.  one file i had been writing in for months daily, and it was turned to nothing but spaces.  this might have been due to a bug from Evernote software interacting with what i can only say is the terrible, relationship-with-windows-ending Windows 8.  whatever problems with windows 8 i have, i have no problem putting on this laptop as a whole, as the laptop came with it.so if you get this laptop, make sure you get it for no more than 300$ - i paid 350 at best buy a year ago and it was too much.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied with the laptop
Reviews.Author: Geanina
Reviews.Content: I need a laptop for my personal use as I am a student, mainly for web browsing, stocking photos and stuff.One thing I didn't consider when buying was that it doesn't have a cd-writer and  one other thing is that the sd card-reader  doesn't seem to work but it probably needs a software or smt.Per all it's a cute laptop, very minimal, but I'm very glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Not good quality
Reviews.Author: Alberto Poot Lopez
Reviews.Content: Not fast enough, mouse is not working propertly, so as the keys, I will rather paid a little more for a DELL

Reviews.Title: Just what I need for most computer tasks
Reviews.Author: Alfred Stanley
Reviews.Content: The 2.4 Ghz processor is fast enough so you can get most things done like word processing, Youtube viewing, etc. 4GB of RAM is fast enough, but I might end up upgrading it to 8 because why not. Space isn't an issue like it was with my old 250gb laptop.

Reviews.Title: Horrible laptop
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: DO NOT GET THIS LAPTOP. This is by far the worst of any electronic item that I have ever used or owned. The spacebar barely works. Even if I hit it really hard, it only registers about 1/2 of the time. Other than that, the build is obviously cheap and poor quality, not to mention that it runs windows 8, which is a whole other issue. I wouldn't pay $20 for this laptop if it were offered for sale at that price. Save yourself the trouble and buy anything else.

Reviews.Title: you get what you paid for.
Reviews.Author: Hawaii
Reviews.Content: I bought the laptop last week. I opened it two days ago. The laptop seems over heated when you use it for over an hour, as is common with asus.  If you want to pick this laptop up get a cooling pad or be prepared for crashes.
